page.title: 01LUDFORD(PT) WYKEHAM & GIRSBY
page.content: This very rural area comprises 20 % of Ludford village and two Hamlets of Wykeham and Girsby, all set on the Lincolnshire Wolds, 130m above sea level. Winds straight off the North Sea and few trees (many removed for wartime airfield) make it a cold place in winter, but it is an attractive unspoiled area. It is bisected by the A631 Market Rasen to Louth road and the River Bain which rises a mile out side the area, both running west to east. Most of the land is arable farming but along the Bain valley are wooded areas including some parkland of the old country houses. Population estimated at 108 _ 65 at Ludford pt. village (13 children), 21 at Wykeham (7 children), 13 at Girsby (4 child'n) and 9 in outlying farms.
